revised_title: Observations of Parhelia and Aurora Borealis
tldr: The author observed and described two atmospheric phenomena: parhelia (mock suns) and the Aurora Borealis. The parhelia appeared as two bright spots on either side of the sun, with colors gradually forming a rainbow-like arch. The Aurora Borealis was observed as a red vapor with small black clouds, followed by streams of red light resembling pillars in the air. These events lasted for about an hour before returning to normal.
